meanings.definition: Modalists: believers in modalism, a theological doctrine that denies the Trinity and asserts that God exists in three different modes or forms.
meanings.sent1: The modalists in our church strongly oppose the concept of the Trinity.
meanings.sent2: Many modalists reject the traditional Christian view of the Trinity.
meanings.sent3: The modalists at the debate made some interesting points about their unique beliefs.
meanings.sent4: In the world of theology, the modalists stand out as challengers to the established doctrines.
meanings.sent5: The modalists' belief in three modes of God is quite controversial in religious circles.

meanings.definition: Modalists: those who adhere to the belief in modalism, a heretical view of the nature of God.
meanings.sent1: We had a discussion with some modalists about their unconventional beliefs.
meanings.sent2: Modalists often face criticism for their rejection of the Trinity.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the modalists joked about their 'unique' perspective on God.
meanings.sent4: The modalists' view of God as having different modes challenges traditional teachings.
meanings.sent5: The modalists' stance on God's nature is considered heretical by many theologians.
